Job Title: IT Project Manager- Governance And Third Party Business Continuity

Location: Charlotte, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, TEKsystems c/o Allegis Group, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Description:

Position Summary

Looking for Project manager skills with strong Development/engineering background to manage Application governance and RISK/Audit related deliverables.

Responsible for application ownership with regard to audit, governance, and maintenance. Manages timelines and has matrix management responsibility. Build positive give and take relationships with stakeholders. This will require the ability to prioritize, lead work efforts, interact with application leaders, and engage/influence Third Party stakeholders across the company.. This position will also be responsible for responding to audit/regulatory requests, as well as escalating and presenting issues to governance forums as it pertains to Third Party Business Continuity. In addition to this, the individual will be involved preparing the governance documents needed for the new initiatives and enhancements in collaboration with development/test leads, project managers and external vendor partners. This individual will develop and maintain strong relationships across Enterprise Resiliency, Global Procurement, Global Information Security, as well as FLU Third Party oversight programs. Typically requires 5-7 years of applicable experience.

 Strong communication skills with ability to communicate well across many stakeholders and experience with senior leader communications. Data driven analytical approach to drive business solutions across the enterprise. Experience in managing multiple and often competing priorities in a fast-paced environment. Proven experience in drafting communications and presentation materials intended for senior audiences and regulators.

Required Skills

Knowledge of Infrastructure Technology programs and projects, Infrastructure delivery projects (servers, storage, network, etc.)

Experience with the Continuity Planning Tool (CPT) and Data Restore process, and Third Party Testing process

4-6 years of hands on experience in payment space, especially for the merchants.

4-6 years of hands on experience working with Information Security to ensure vendor application vulnerability remediated

Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with quick adaptation to new technologies, methodologies, and systems

Excellent communication and documentation skills with the ability to convey message to a broad audience

Detail-oriented and persistent, able to drive complicated tasks through to completion

Ability to work in a globally cross functional, collaborative team environment

Excellent interpersonal skills; positive attitude; team player; flexible

Strong written and verbal communication skills, able to lead meetings, follow-up, negotiate and resolve ambiguity

Keen attention to detail and strong sense of ownership and accountability for work

Motivated to work closely and cooperatively with other team members of varying levels of seniority and experience

Must be a self-starter and have the ability to work with little to no supervision

 Strong communication skills with ability to communicate well across many stakeholders and experience with senior leader communications. Data driven analytical approach to drive business solutions across the enterprise. Experience in managing multiple and often competing priorities in a fast-paced environment. Proven experience in drafting communications and presentation materials intended for senior audiences and regulators.

Desired Skills

 Experience with complaint program elements, including complaint capture, resolution and/or thematic analysis processes.

Previous Merchant application experience

Additional Skills & Qualifications:

This person will work with Hassan on Application ownership work focused on audit, governance and maintenance of applications/infrastructure technology.

About TEKsystems:

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. IT Project Manager- Governance And Third Party Business Continuity

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
